nodes.documentation:
Crowdsale state machine without buy functionality.
 * Implements basic state machine logic, but leaves out all buy functions,
so that subclasses can implement their own buying logic.
 *
For the default buy() implementation see Crowdsale.sol.
nodes.name: CrowdsaleBase

nodes.documentation: Don't expect to just send in money and get tokens.

nodes.name: buyTokens
investInternal
calculateTokens

nodes.documentation:
Finalize a succcesful crowdsale.
   * The owner can triggre a call the contract that provides post-crowdsale actions, like releasing the tokens.
nodes.name: finalize

nodes.documentation:
Allow to (re)set finalize agent.
   * Design choice: no state restrictions on setting this, so that we can fix fat finger mistakes.
nodes.name: setFinalizeAgent

nodes.documentation:
Allow crowdsale owner to close early or extend the crowdsale.
   * This is useful e.g. for a manual soft cap implementation:
- after X amount is reached determine manual closing
   * This may put the crowdsale to an invalid state,
but we trust owners know what they are doing.
nodes.name: setEndsAt

nodes.documentation:
Allow to (re)set pricing strategy.
   * Design choice: no state restrictions on the set, so that we can fix fat finger mistakes.
nodes.name: setPricingStrategy

nodes.documentation:
Allow to change the team multisig address in the case of emergency.
   * This allows to save a deployed crowdsale wallet in the case the crowdsale has not yet begun
(we have done only few test transactions). After the crowdsale is going
then multisig address stays locked for the safety reasons.
nodes.name: setMultisig

nodes.documentation:
Allow load refunds back on the contract for the refunding.
   * The team can transfer the funds back on the smart contract in the case the minimum goal was not reached..
nodes.name: loadRefund

nodes.documentation:
Investors can claim refund.
   * Note that any refunds from proxy buyers should be handled separately,
and not through this contract.
nodes.name: refund

nodes.documentation: @return true if the crowdsale has raised enough money to be a successful.
nodes.name: isMinimumGoalReached

nodes.documentation: Check if the contract relationship looks good.
nodes.name: isFinalizerSane

nodes.documentation: Check if the contract relationship looks good.
nodes.name: isPricingSane

nodes.documentation:
Crowdfund state machine management.
   * We make it a function and do not assign the result to a variable, so there is no chance of the variable being stale.
nodes.name: getState

nodes.documentation: This is for manual testing of multisig wallet interaction
nodes.name: setOwnerTestValue

nodes.documentation:
Allow addresses to do early participation.
   * TODO: Fix spelling error in the name
nodes.name: setEarlyParicipantWhitelist

nodes.documentation: Interface marker.
nodes.name: isCrowdsale

nodes.documentation: Modified allowing execution only if the crowdsale is currently running.
nodes.name: inState
isBreakingCap

nodes.documentation: Check if the current crowdsale is full and we can no longer sell any tokens.
nodes.name: isCrowdsaleFull

nodes.documentation: Create new tokens or transfer issued tokens to the investor depending on the cap model.
nodes.name: assignTokens
